mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Christie Johnson to Mary Goodrich, 1859 April 16
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Johnson, Christie
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from Christie Johnson to Mary Goodrich, Vice Regent for Connecticut, April 16, 1859. Regent's appreciation of Connecticut's activities; comments on a man's offer to guide Association; refers to Constitution and fact that she has best legal advice on important questions; no action regarding Mr. Thornburn can be taken until Grant Council meets; first outlays for repairs of the perishable, needs an architect for this; comments on J.A. Washington's cooperation but her unwillingness to start repairs before the Association takes possession; Washington family alarmed at moving from Mount Vernon before their new home is finished; investment of funds and payments to Mr. Washington.
